container.heading: Minimum Standards for Mobile Veterinary Clinics

section.heading: Scope.
section.text: This chapter applies to any veterinarian who operates a mobile veterinary clinic offering or providing veterinary services for companion animals.

section.heading: Definitions.
section.text: “Mobile veterinary clinic” means a mobile unit in which veterinary services are provided to animals that are treated inside the mobile unit.

section.heading: Sanitation.
section.text: To the extent practicable, a veterinarian who operates a mobile clinic shall comply with the sanitation practices outlined in COMAR 15.14.03.

section.heading: Care of Medicine.
section.text: A veterinarian who operates a mobile clinic shall provide for the refrigeration and proper care of medicine to be used at the mobile clinic.

section.heading: Care of Equipment.
section.text: A veterinarian who operates a mobile clinic shall provide for the proper care of equipment and the proper hygiene of employees. Proper hygiene includes the washing of hands and the sanitizing of examination tables.

para.text: A mobile veterinary clinic may not offer or provide veterinary services unless it has a valid hospital license.
The owner of more than one mobile veterinary clinic shall obtain a hospital license for each mobile clinic.
The licensing fee for a mobile veterinary clinic shall be the same as that required for a veterinary hospital.
The licensing requirements set forth in COMAR 15.14.03.01-1 also apply to mobile clinics.

section.heading: Surgery.
section.text: Surgery may not be performed at a mobile clinic unless the minimum standards set forth in COMAR 15.14.03.04 are met.

section.heading: Oxygen Delivery.
section.text: A suitably equipped area shall include a positive pressure oxygen delivery system for small animal patients where medically indicated, regardless of whether surgery is performed in the mobile veterinary clinic.
